snippet: Researchers seeking to document whether running out of food stamps or money for food at the end of the month damaged people’s health found a high correlation.
abstract: Researchers find high correlation between hospital visits for poor diabetic patients and their tight budgets at end of month when food stamps or money for food run out; no increase was found in such hospitalizations among higher-income people for condition known as hypoglycemia, suggesting that poverty and exhausted food budgets may be reason for the increased health risk; findings appear in journal Health Affairs.
lead_paragraph: Researchers seeking to document whether running out of food stamps or money for food at the end of the month damaged people’s health found a high correlation.

headline.main: Study Ties Diabetic Crises to Dip in Food Budgets
headline.print_headline: Study Ties Diabetic Crises to Dip in Food Budgets

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
